speaker: Daphne
text: Hey!

speaker: Martin
text: [_grumbling_] Thanks, Daph.

speaker: Niles
text: He-hey, Dad!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, boy.  You missed me, huh?

speaker: Daphne
text: So, how was your trip, Mr. Crane?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, the hunting was awful.  I didn't bag a damned thing. [_hangs up his coat_] Duke and I sat there for two days just waiting for something to happen.  It's like when Frasier took me to see "Nicholas Nickleby."  Thank God this time I had a gun!

speaker: Niles
text: Dinner is almost ready.  Shall I set you a place or would it make you feel better to go out and shoot your own eggplant? _Martin sits down before Frasier enters through the front door, looking characteristically annoyed and bewildered at Martin's hunting gear, which are laid on the floor._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, what have I told you about bivouacking in the entrance way?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, how was your hunting trip?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, came home empty-handed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear.  I guess that means for the next several weeks we'll hear you grouse about the grouse and carp about the carp. [_laughs at his own joke as he carries Martin's bags over to the hallway_]

speaker: Niles
text: You've been working on that, haven't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there was traffic! _Frasier exits to Martin's room with the bags in tow.  A ping is then heard from the kitchen._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Daphne - I have to take the roast out of the oven.  I need the recipe for the glaze.  Could you get it?  It's in my briefcase; in the "Burnt Sienna" colored folder.

speaker: Daphne
text: No problem.

speaker: Martin
text: Brown.  But don't tell anyone I know that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad - sorry to hear your trip was a bust.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it's all right, it wasn't so bad.  You know, the worst day of hunting still beats the best day of working.

speaker: Frasier
text: You don't work either! _Daphne, holding the folder, walks downstage.  Something seems to take her attention._

speaker: Martin
text: You don't think it's work talking to you?  Duke, on the other hand, is a lot of fun.  You know he can fit twenty- seven marshmallows into his mouth at one time. _A cricket is heard distinctly from within the apartment.  Daphne and Frasier look around._

speaker: Frasier
text: What was that?

speaker: Martin
text: What was what?

speaker: Frasier
text: That!  That's a cricket.

speaker: Martin
text: How did that get in here?

speaker: Frasier
text: It must have stowed away in your gear; get rid of it!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, don't worry - Eddie'll take care of it.  Terriers are born hunters. [_puts him down_] Go get him, boy. _Eddie responds to Martin's orders by chasing his tail round and round and round and...  Reset to: Kitchen Meanwhile, in the kitchen, Niles has taken the roast out of the oven. Daphne enters looking rather uneasy, evidently from reading his files._

speaker: Daphne
text: So.... This woman is in love with you.

speaker: Niles
text: [_concentrating on the roast_] What?

speaker: Daphne
text: Heather Murphy.  Says right here she's obsessed with you.

speaker: Niles
text: [_realizing_] Oh, wrong file - you're not supposed to look at that.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, I can see why.  And when were you planning on telling me about this?

speaker: Niles
text: [_out of pure honesty_] Em, never. [_taking the files_] These are session notes, they're confidential.

speaker: Daphne
text: But she is in love with you?

speaker: Niles
text: First of all I can't discuss the woman in this file...  which, by the way, is clearly umber and not "Burnt Sienna!" I can tell you that it's very common for patients to displace feelings they have for someone else onto their psychiatrist. It's called transference.  So even if a patient thinks she might be in love with me, she really isn't.  And usually those feelings disappear as therapy progresses.  Okay?

speaker: Daphne
text: Okay.

speaker: Daphne
text: So how did she tell you?  Did she come on to you?  Did she try and kiss you?

speaker: Niles
text: I can't tell you.

speaker: Daphne
text: All right.  I understand.  Your little secret.

speaker: Daphne
text: Just blink.  Once for yes and twice for no. _Frasier enters in search of the dreaded cricket.  Martin enters with him._

speaker: Frasier
text: I think it's coming from in here.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad has brought home a cricket!

speaker: Niles
text: [_genuine fear_] A cricket?!  Get behind me, Daphne.

speaker: Frasier
text: Everybody freeze!   Don't-move-a-muscle. _Frasier, with small gestures, points to its position of the floor. Suddenly he makes his move.  He stamps.  Everyone holds their breath. Frasier removes his foot before proudly announcing..._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I hope that cricket saw what I just did to this toasted almond! _Frasier exits as the rest peer over the squashed nut.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - Caf e Nervosa. Frasier, munching away at a scone, is whining to Roz about the cricket.  They are sat at a front table. _

speaker: Frasier
text: I tell you, Roz, it was the worst night of my life.  Just as I begin to doze off, the damned cricket would start strigilating again.  Honestly, have you any idea what it's like to be awaken intermittently throughout an entire night?!

speaker: Roz
text: I have a three-year-old, I can't remember the last time I slept through a night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course, but this constant chirping and chirping, over and over -- really, you can't imagine it.

speaker: Roz
text: Really?  Did the cricket crawl into bed with you?  Did the cricket throw up on you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Gee, I wish I had a three-year-old so I could win every argument! _Daphne enters the caf e and greets Frasier and Roz. _

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Daph.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane. [_sits with them_] Oh, that scone looks good.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, it's all right.  They call it "Nervosa Berry," but I'm convinced it's just yesterday's banana.  I have half a mind to have a discussion with someone about it.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_agreeable_] You should. [_here's the reason why_] So what do you know about transference?

speaker: Frasier
text: Hm?  Oh, more than most.

speaker: Daphne
text: Is it true that patients can actually fall in love with their therapists?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, yes, as a matter of fact it's quite common.  You see, in a therapeutic setting a doctor's empathy can be misconstrued as romantic interest, especially when the patient is of a particularly vulnerable nature.

speaker: Daphne
text: But therapists never return those feelings, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_contemplating, perhaps with Diane in mind_] Well, they're not supposed to.  But it does happen.  Eh, well, I mean, think about it, really, it's... we are human.  Transference can be very, very powerful.  I remember back in my days of private practice, uh, I did have my share of female adulation.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God, were you able to cure them?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gives her a look_] I'm not a miracle worker, Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Do you smell bananas?

speaker: Frasier
text: I knew it!  You smell it too! [_to a passing waiter_] Excuse me.  This day-old scone is fooling no-one. [_the waiter passes, Frasier stands in anger_] Don't you walk away from me.  Don't you dare walk away from me.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, so who is she?

speaker: Daphne
text: Who's who?

speaker: Roz
text: Niles' patient?

speaker: Daphne
text: All right.  I saw one of his files by mistake.  The woman is madly in love with him.

speaker: Roz
text: So who is she?

speaker: Daphne
text: Her name is Heather Murphy.

speaker: Roz
text: Heather, huh?  That's trouble.  What else do you know?

speaker: Daphne
text: That's it.  I only got a quick look at the files.

speaker: Roz
text: So what are you going to do?

speaker: Daphne
text: Nothing.  Niles said he can't talk about his patients. So, what choice do I have?  I should trust him.

speaker: Roz
text: If I found out some babe was after my guy I would have to know everything about her.  What she looks like, her profession, what she's being treated for.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, I don't think that's relevant.

speaker: Roz
text: What if she's a sex addict?

speaker: Daphne
text: You can be treated for that?

speaker: Roz
text: [_cynical_] So they say. **CLASH OF THE TITANS** _Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. The cricket is heard.  When the scene fades in, Frasier is battering the kitchen worktops with a fly swatter._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_unsuccessful_] Damn it!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez, are you still at it?  Why don't you go in your room?  You won't even hear the thing if you close the door.

speaker: Frasier
text: Close my door?!  And just concede defeat.  I know, here's a better idea: I'll just move out and let him have the run of the place!  That's good, I'll have two apartments; One for me, one for my cricket! [_off Martin's look_] I tried closing my door, I can still hear it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, can't you make him shut up?!

speaker: Martin
text: That prayer doesn't get answered around here!

speaker: Frasier
text: This is your fault!  You're the one who brought him here.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sits_] What's the big deal?  If you were paying a ton of money to stay in some country inn, you'd be loving the sound of crickets.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I love a babbling brook too, but it doesn't mean I want one surging through my condo!  I'm calling an exterminator.

speaker: Martin
text: No, you can't do that!  The chemicals are too dangerous for Eddie.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, fine.  You have twenty-four hours to get that intruder out of here or I'm calling, Eddie or no Eddie!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking around the room, incensed_] It taunts me! _FADE TO:  Scene Four - Niles' Bedroom at the Montana. Daphne is sitting up in bed wearing a black teddy whilst Niles is getting undressed.  She still has worry written on her face._

speaker: Daphne
text: So, how was your day?

speaker: Niles
text: Fine.  Thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Why don't you tell me about it?

speaker: Niles
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, couples come home, they talk about their day. Why don't you ever want to share?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I-I... suppose I'm not used to it.

speaker: Niles
text: Maris always needed silence to cope with her chronic migraines, Mel couldn't talk because she'd be wearing the moulds from her teeth bleaching kit.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm interested.  Why don't you tell me something about your day?

speaker: Niles
text: Okay.  Let me think. [_suddenly, excited_] I saw the best pair of driving gloves!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_less interested than him_] That's good.  Anything else?

speaker: Niles
text: I had a cob salad for lunch. [_beat_] You're right, that was fun. [_stands_] Okay, I'm going to go; brush my teeth.  I'll be right back.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_still anxious_] Okay. _Daphne turns on the television to take her mind off of the situation. Mary Hart is presenting "Entertainment Tonight."  A Julia Roberts press photo can be seen._

speaker: Hart
text: Julia Roberts just signed on for twenty million dollars to play a woman who falls in love with her psychiatrist.  Of course, she gets him in the end.  Sound familiar, Daphne? _Julia Roberts's photo is exchanged for one of Daphne, who gapes at the television._ [_N.B. The photo used was an old press photo of Jane Leeves from season five._]

speaker: Hart
text: Look in the briefcase, I know I would.  And now let's hear the details... _Daphne, realizing her subconscious at work, quickly turns off the television.  She stares longingly at Niles' briefcase, but reaches for a magazine instead.  She opens the magazine just to find a picture of a briefcase and the words "JUST OPEN IT" stamped underneath it.  She closes the magazine with confusion.  She cannot resist any longer.  Daphne gets out of bed, walks to the briefcase and begins to open it. However, she is interrupted by Niles re-entering wearing his dressing gown.  Daphne quickly turns around and sighs._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thank God.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looks up_] What? [_smiles_]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_covering_] I missed you.

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm.  I missed you too.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, my beeper's going off.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_seductive_] Well, let's see what we can do about that.

speaker: Niles
text: It could be an emergency.

speaker: Daphne
text: Who is it?

speaker: Niles
text: [_pulls out of the hug_] Ooh, uh, it's a patient.

speaker: Daphne
text: That woman?

speaker: Niles
text: I really can't talk about it.  Daphne, I'm sorry, I may be a while. _He exits to the hallway.  Daphne goes to the briefcase and slowly opens it.  She checks that Niles is well out of sight before she removes the documents and takes them onto her lap.  She reads with frightened interest.  End of Act One  Act Two  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. The following day, Frasier has been trying to have a nap on the sofa as Martin awakens him.  He is holding a shoe-box._

speaker: Frasier
text: I was trying to.  I'm attempting to re-arrange my schedule. Apparently, His Royal Chirpy-ness is nocturnal, so I have to be as well.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I've got the answer to the problem right here in this box. [_lays it down on the table_]

speaker: Frasier
text: What, we couldn't squash him with the shoes we already own?

speaker: Martin
text: [_taking jacket off_] Not shoes.  Eddie's vet told me to get a gecko.  It's a cricket-predator.  You know, like you get lady- bugs to eat aphids, if somebody would let me grow tomatoes on the terrace!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I told you, it's a condo board regulation: no fruiting plants.

speaker: Martin
text: Whatever.  Anyway, just give me a half-an-hour and I'll have that pesky cricket out of the kitchen and inside this gecko.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  So we set a lizard loose to catch the cricket?

speaker: Martin
text: Mmm-hmm.

speaker: Frasier
text: Then what? [_Martin looks confused_] We get an owl to eat the gecko?!  Then we get a tiger to eat the owl? [_pause_] What eats the tiger, Dad, tell me that!

speaker: Martin
text: An alligator, for one, smart guy!  But that's not going to happen and you know why?  Because we'll put a little harness on the gecko so it doesn't run away.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic_] Oh, this just gets better and better. _Martin goes over to the small table outside the kitchen.  He searches in the drawer._

speaker: Martin
text: I thought I had some twine here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I used it to stabilize a veal shank.  Why don't you just make a little harness out of, uh...  the dental floss.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, that's not bad!

speaker: Frasier
text: I wasn't serious... not my cinnamon waxed! _But it's too late and Martin's left.  FADE TO:_ **WHICH FLOOR IS THE "OTHER WOMAN" DEPARTMENT?** _Scene Two - Heather Murphy's Office Building. Roz and Daphne are riding the elevator to Heather's floor._

speaker: Daphne
text: I've changed my mind, I can't go through with this.

speaker: Roz
text: You have to, Daphne.  You know you're not going to sleep until you see what this Heather looks like.

speaker: Daphne
text: I thought I'd feel better once I'd got a look at her file, instead I feel worse.  She's successful, well travelled, well educated, what if she's gorgeous too?

speaker: Roz
text: Daphne, you've got this all built up in your head.  Once you see her, you'll know what you're up against.

speaker: Daphne
text: I suppose.  But what if we get caught?

speaker: Roz
text: We lie.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm a terrible liar.

speaker: Roz
text: Listen up.  Lying is all about confidence.  As long as you're confident, people will believe anything you tell them.

speaker: Daphne
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier thinks I'm at the copy machine right now! _Daphne looks gobsmacked as the door opens.  Roz enters, confidently, and goes towards the assistant.  Daphne follows nervously._

speaker: Roz
text: Excuse me, we're looking for Heather Murphy.

speaker: Assistant
text: This is her office.  And you are?

speaker: Roz
text: Her two 'o clock!

speaker: Assistant
text: [_checks computer_] I don't have anything on the books.

speaker: Roz
text: This is unbelievable. [_to Daphne_] Make a note: Re-evaluate all scheduling procedures, C.C. all department heads.

speaker: Assistant
text: Heather'll be back in five minutes if you want to wait.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, we'll wait.  In the meantime, two coffees, cream with sugar, think you can handle that?!

speaker: Assistant
text: [_scared_] Yes.

speaker: Roz
text: We'll be in her office.  Let's go. _Roz exits to Heather's office.  Daphne simply cannot move, she simply stands behind looking fearful at the assistant._

speaker: Roz
text: [_shouts in a style we'll now call Lana-esque_] NOW! _Daphne and the assistant both jump off their feet.  She enters the office whilst he runs to the coffee machine._

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, I think coffee might make me more nervous.

speaker: Roz
text: We're not going to drink it.  I'm just trying to buy some time so that we can look around.  She's got to be in one of these pictures somewhere.

speaker: Daphne
text: There's a lot of people there.  Which one do you suppose she is?

speaker: Roz
text: [_referring to a woman who has just appeared at the entrance to the office_] I think it's the one who looks like her.

speaker: Heather
text: Excuse me, can I help you?

speaker: Roz
text: We flew in from corporate for a meeting which the geniuses in your department managed to screw up.  I don't know what kind of monkey business is going on around here, but we are this close to shutting this entire branch down.

speaker: Heather
text: How could you fly in from corporate?  Corporate's downstairs! _Roz suddenly loses her confidence and flees from the office back to the elevator._

speaker: Heather
text: I'm calling security.  Who are you?

speaker: Daphne
text: Who am I? [_with growing dignity and confidence_] Who am I?

speaker: Roz
text: [_Lana-esque_] JUST RUN! _She does - past a very confused assistant carrying two coffees.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's Kitchen. That evening, Frasier and Martin are sat on the kitchen stools. Frasier is wearing an oven mitt for protection, while Martin is holding a trail of dental floss connected to a gecko on the floor. So, business as usual then..._

speaker: Frasier
text: It's asleep, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: No, it's not.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really, he hasn't twitched his tail for two minutes.

speaker: Martin
text: That's because he's lulling him into a false sense of security. The most dangerous part of a gecko is its mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: What-are-you-talking-about?  A gecko's brain is, like, this big. [_holds his thumb and fore finger apart by less than an inch_]

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, but a cricket's brain is only this big. [_holds his thumb and forefinger touching each other_]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, fine.  Where were we?

speaker: Martin
text: [_thinks a moment, then_] Ann Margaret.

speaker: Frasier
text: You cannot just blurt out "Ann Margaret" like that.  I'm sorry, we can only take ten women to Love Island, all right?  We have to put a little thought into this.  I'll tell you who makes my list: that dark haired temptress who works at the bookstore.

speaker: Martin
text: [_smiling_] Lisa.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know her name?

speaker: Martin
text: Are you kidding?

speaker: Frasier
text: All this time you've been going down there, I... I thought you belonged to some kind of book club.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, there's a club all right!  You know, she got a belly ring last week.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_off in a fantasy_] That's fantastic!

speaker: Martin
text: [_stands_] Here, hold onto this for a minute, will ya, while I grab a beer?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure. _Frasier takes control of the dental floss as Martin moves to the refrigerator.  Suddenly, the floss springs taut._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ooh, Dad, Dad!  He's making his move, I can feel him!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, all right, give him a little play!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reels out the thread_] Right, I am doing...

speaker: Martin
text: A little more-

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Martin
text: A little more-

speaker: Frasier
text: Right. _The cricket makes its noise.  Then suddenly it is ceased by the sound of crunching._

speaker: Martin
text: He got him!  Reel him in!  Not too fast now, not too fast, you don't want to tug at it.

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't believe this worked.  That was amazing! [_picks up the gecko with his protected hand_]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh great work, buddy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: I meant the gecko.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, of course. [_to gecko_] Good job, well done. [_places him back into the box_]

speaker: Martin
text: Will you be using this floss anymore?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gives him a look_] I think we'll just let him keep it, all right?

speaker: Martin
text: Okay.

speaker: Frasier
text: There we go.  In you go, little man.  Congratulations. [_puts the lid on_] Well, that's it.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  Cricket's dead.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, even though I am savoring the newfound silence, I, uh, sort of miss the excitement of the hunt.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, well, all right.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad... [_Martin returns_] Were you aware that the male cricket chirps in order to attract the female cricket?

speaker: Martin
text: Wow... and that cricket was doing an awful lot of chirping.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you thinkin' what I'm thinkin'?

speaker: Martin
text: There might be another cricket.

speaker: Frasier
text: There might be more than one.  I'd hate to go to bed and then have to get up again.

speaker: Martin
text: Probably we should just play it safe.

speaker: Frasier
text: Release the gecko.

speaker: Martin
text: Yes! _Frasier puts on the oven mitt again as Martin re-opens the box -- both content with their newfound excitement.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - Niles' Office. Niles is doing some reading as Daphne knocks on his door. _

speaker: Niles
text: Well, this is an unexpected treat.

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, I have something to tell you.

speaker: Niles
text: Is it that I'm the sexiest man you've ever known?

speaker: Daphne
text: No. [_beat_] I mean yes you are, yes, but that's not why I'm here.

speaker: Niles
text: Is something wrong?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well sort of. [_carefully_] It's about Heather Murphy.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, I've told you.  I cannot talk about my patients.

speaker: Daphne
text: You don't have to.  I found out by myself.

speaker: Niles
text: [_thoughtful pause_] Did you look in my briefcase?

speaker: Niles
text: [_angry_] You read her file?!

speaker: Daphne
text: I know, I know, it's bad. _Niles goes to the door and closes it for some privacy.  He raises his voice.  He feels passionate about his work._

speaker: Niles
text: Those files are confidential.  How could you?

speaker: Daphne
text: Look, before you get going, you should probably know...

speaker: Niles
text: No, there is no excuse.  That is the worse thing you could have done!

speaker: Daphne
text: You would think so.

speaker: Niles
text: What else did you do?

speaker: Daphne
text: I went down to her office to see what she looks like.  Well, she never found out who I was or why I was there - I know it doesn't make it okay.  But I was just so worried and I had to find out who she was, and [_in tears_] I'm so sorry, I feel so ashamed! [_cries_] It was all Roz's idea!

speaker: Daphne
text: Look, I know you're angry, but Niles, please, say something.

speaker: Niles
text: Anger doesn't begin to describe it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: You have violated this person's privacy.  If she found out, I... they could suspend my license.

speaker: Daphne
text: I am so sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: And you don't trust me.  How could you possibly think there could be somebody else?

speaker: Daphne
text: Because I was somebody else.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: You were married to two other women while you claimed to be in love with me.  Now that we're together how can I be sure, really sure, that there won't ever be another "somebody else"?

speaker: Niles
text: Because I would never... _He pauses, realizing he has been through this before -- and perhaps that he has not yet asked himself this question. _

speaker: Niles
text: Because this time it's different.  Our love is different. It's not based on somebody's expectations or...  or anything I'm supposed to be.  When I was with Maris, or with Mel, I found myself thinking about you.  Going about my day or even when I was in a session, I found myself thinking about you. Well, now we're together.  I find myself thinking about you. It's not going to stop.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm still mad at you.

speaker: Daphne
text: I know.
